attributes.action: Office of JCIO to Rescinde all commitments made by Justices in breech of rights
attributes.additional_details: Part 1.1C of The criminal procedure rules 2015 is a legal requirement for all parties to recognize & act to help further all legitimate rights claims. You are recognizing & acting on fit notes from GP surgeries & hospitals. MPs & JCIO aren't recognizing & acting on 1688 bill of rights; Right to Petition claims, the right of subjects where policing is being performed by Citizens using that protection prior to prosecution. The painted Chamber committee's of the 1640 Long parliament championed this
attributes.background: Lord Chief Justice & Lord Chancellor the Judicial Conduct and Investigations office together with the Police, CPS and Probation service to immediately & without delay or fee to direct all Justices to recognize all outstanding rights claims & rescind all commitments for valid claims awaiting action

rejection.details: We can only accept petitions about things the Government or House of Commons are responsible for. The judiciary, including the JCIO, are independent from the Government and Parliament.
